campaigns.title: Airborne lidar on NASA Electra Pinatubo aerosol survey flights

instrument: Nd:YAG lidar (532 nm): backscatter and depolarisation (for ash within plume)
periods: 21st to 26th May 1992 – Pinatubo aerosol survey legs from 52°S to 37°N

campaigns.title: Ship-borne lidar on Russian Zubov (July-Sep 1991) and Vize (Jan-Feb 1992) vessels

instrument: Zubov: yttrium-aluminium (539nm)
Vize: dye-R6W (589nm): backscatter only
data.pi: Phillippe Keckhut, (LATMOS, U. Versailles Saint-Quentin, France)
periods: Jul 1991 (39°N to 19 °N; 16 soundings in the month)
Aug 1991 (21°N to 10 °N; 18 soundings in the month)
Sep 1991 (8°N to 43 °N; 14 soundings in the month)
Jan 1992 (8°S to 14 °N; 6 soundings in the month)
Feb 1992 (20°N to 59 °N; 5 soundings in the month)

campaigns.title: Ship-borne lidar (Penn. State Univ.) on German Polarstern vessel (Oct 1991 to Jan 1992)

instrument: Nd:YAG lidar (1064, 532 and 355nm)
periods: Sep91 to Jan92 (70°N to 65°S); at least 24 measurements nights are reported but No inventory or list of measurements days is yet available.

Apr92 to May92 (41°N); after the LADIMAS campaign the lidar was returned to Penn. State Univ. and the Pinatubo aerosol measured with the same lidar from this site. No inventory or list of measurements days are yet available.

campaigns.title: Ground-based lidar at Aspendale, Melbourne, Australia (38°S), Jul 1991 to Dec 1992

instrument: Nd:YAG lidar (355nm, 532nm) – with polarisers on some soundings.
periods: Feb, Mar and Apr 1992 – 1 sounding in each month
Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec 1992 – 1 sounding in each month

campaigns.title: Ground-based lidar at Aberystwyth, Wales, U.K. (52°N) -- Aug 1991 to March 1992

instrument: Nd:YAG lidar (532nm) with polarisers on all soundings for ash within plume

campaigns.title: Balloon-borne OPC25/dust-sondes, Minneapolis, Panama Canal (Panama), Churchill (Canada)

instrument: Dust-sonde (same design as OPC25 in Laramie soundings) with 1 or 2 size channels: N(diameter, Dp>275nm/300nm), N(Dp>375nm/450nm)
periods: 4 soundings in 1964 (11th Jan, 5th May, 19th Aug, 29th Oct 1964)
4 soundings in 1965 (28th Apr, 22nd Jul, 12th Oct, 22nd Dec 1965)

campaigns.title: Balloon-borne solar extinction measurements, Minneapolis and Panama Canal (Panama)

instrument: 4-telescope instrument to measure solar extinction at 4 wavelengths (367nm, 430nm, 595nm and 910nm).
The solar near-infra-red channel (910nm) measured aerosol extinction directly and the data is shown in Figures in the Annexe to Ted Pepin’s (1970) PhD thesis.

campaigns.title: Ground-based lidar, Lexington Massachusetts (42°N) and College, Alaska (65°N)

instrument: Ruby lidar (694nm)
data.pi: Giorgio Fiocco, MIT, deceased  (backscatter ratio profiles tabulated in Gerald Grams PhD thesis)

campaigns.title: Searchlight measurements of Agung aerosol extinction (550nm) from New Mexico, USA (32°N)

instrument: US Army 60-inch anti-aircraft searchlight (General Electric Company model 1942) and 8-inch photo-multiplier detector (type C7140), see Elterman (1951)

Vertical profiles of scattered signals from searchlight using broadband emission (designed for density measurements) conducted at Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA). Needs reprocessing (with searchlight algorithms) for single-wavelength aerosol scattering.
data.pi: Louis Elterman, deceased (AFCRL, Bedford, Massachusetts - n.b. Elterman (1966) “Atlas of aerosol attenuation” has Figures of 105 vertical profiles of the aerosol attenuation and extinction coefficients at 550nm derived from searchlight measurements conducted at Albuquerque, New Mexico. Data will need to be digitized).
periods: 1964 (83 profiles): Feb (12 profiles), Mar (6 profiles), April (28 profiles), May (9 profiles), Jun (8 profiles), Jul (3 profiles), Sept (2 profiles), Oct (6 profiles), Nov (4 profiles), Dec (5 profiles)
Also around 60 searchlight soundings in 1965 and 40 in 1970 (see Elterman et al., 1973, Table 1)

campaigns.title: High-altitude airborne in-situ impactor samples from 1963-65 Project Stardust U-2 flights

data.pi: James Friend, deceased (Isotopes Inc, Westwood, New Jersey, USA)
periods: Size distribution of Agung aerosol measured on 3 NH flights (May, Jun, Aug 1963) (see Table 3 of Friend, 1966) and on 12 SH flights in sub-tropics and mid-latitudes 1963/4):
sample 266: 7th May 1963 (31°N-33°N); sample 268: 30th July 1963 (32°N-33°N); sample 271: 13th Aug 1963 (32°N-32°N)

sample xx1 : 11th Apr 1963 (15°S-35°S); sample xx2: 14th May 1963 (19°S-32°S); sample xx3: 28th May 1963 (18°S-25°S); sample xx4: 11th Jun 1963 (21°S-28°S); sample xx5:   9th Jul 1963 (15°S-21°S); sample xx6: 6th Aug 1963 (15°S-21°S); sample xx7: 12th Dec 1963 (15°S-19°S); sample xx8: 2nd Apr 1964 (15°S-18°S)

8 Southern Hemisphere mid-latitude U-2 flights: sample yy1 : 7th May 1963 (41°S-44°S); sample yy2: 21st May 1963 (40°S-44°S); sample yy3:  4th Jun 1963 (41°S-45°S); sample yy4: 18th Jun 1963 (40°S-45°S); sample yy5:  3rd Jul 1963 (40°S-44°S); sample yy6: 30th Jul 1963 (41°S-44°S); sample yy7: 3rd Dec 1963 (43°S-44°S); sample yy8: 7th Apr 1964 (41°S-45°S)

campaigns.title: North America balloon-borne nuclei counter flights

instrument: Nuclei counter (Aitken-type expansion growth chamber, water as working fluid) measuring vertical profile of particle concentrations (10<Dp<100nm)
data.pi: Christian Junge, deceased (US AFCRL, Bedford, Massachusetts, USA)

instrument: US Army 60-inch anti-aircraft searchlight (General Electric Company model 1942) and 8-inch photo-multiplier detector (type C7140), see Elterman (1951).

Vertical profiles of scattered signals from searchlight using broadband emission (designed for density measurements) conducted at Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA). Note 20.5km separation between searchlight (Cedro Peak, 2.4km altitude) and detector (Sandia Crest, 3.5km altitude).
Needs reprocessing (with searchlight algorithms) for single-wavelength aerosol scattering.

campaigns.title: High-altitude airborne in-situ impactor samples from 1960-1962 Project Stardust U-2 flights

instrument: U-2 impaction-type particle collector samples – impaction onto surfaces of carbon on nitrocellulose film on electron-microscope specimen grids (see Stebbins, 1961, section 3, pages 20- 29; and Friend, 1966 for details on the instrumentation and analysis methods).
data.pi: James Friend, deceased (Isotopes Inc, Westwood, New Jersey, USA)
periods: Data for 8 samples in 1960 (5 of which are tropical/sub-tropical, see Table 3 page 29 of Stebbins, 1961; and Figures 8 and 12 of Junge & Manson, 1961)
9 NH mid-latitude samples in 1962 (see Tables 1-3 of Friend, 1966)
